misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct loop-based pattern generation)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes nested loops can be used to control rows (outer loop) and columns/characters per row (inner loop), incrementing the count of asterisks each row until reaching N.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No gap detected. This matches Java’s execution model: the outer while loop iterates from 1..N, and for each row the inner while loop prints exactly 'a' asterisks, then a newline.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: None; output is correct for positive integer N.
